data.title: Use capture phase for mouseup handler
data.body:
Fixes #15295

This ensures that we always handle the mouseup even if the mouse is outside of the editor when the button is released, and also fixes a weird interaction with the `atom-terminal-panel` package.

data.title: Suppress default-prevented composition events on compositionstart instead of compositionupdate
data.body:
Fixes #15344

In #15314, @as-cii found a workaround to composition events still firing after a default-prevented keydown event. Unfortunately, applying this workaround in the `compositionupdate` handler instead of the `compositionstart` handler meant we still created a composition checkpoint. Then, on the next input event, we detected the presence of this checkpoint and reverted to it, causing the cursor to move as in #15344.

This PR moves the same logic from #15314 to `compositionstart` and avoids creation of a composition checkpoint following a default-prevented keydown event.

/cc @as-cii @ungb @Ben3eeE

data.title: Round return values of getMaxScrollTop, getScrollHeight
data.body:
Fixes #15343

If the current `scrollTop`/`scrollLeft` value exceeds the `maxScrollTop` / `maxScrollLeft`, we reassign the values to the max on read. This allows us to behave correctly when the editor has changed in dimensions or the content has changed since the scroll position was previously assigned.

Prior to this PR, we were applying `Math.round` to the scroll positions when assigning them but **not** rounding the values when reassigning them to the max.

In situations where the content height contains fractional pixels, this can lead to a fractional-pixel scroll position when scrolled all the way down/right which causes blurry text. This can also cause unexpected firing of `onDidChangeScrollTop` when the value isn't actually changing due to a decision to notify listeners based on a rounded-up value not matching a fractional clipped value, as was the case in #15343.

/cc @t9md @Ben3eeE

data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:

    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

I'm trying out edge (586b818b) since #15314 was merged. I have a command bound to alt-n (a composing diacritic in the macOS US keyboard layout) that moves the cursor. Under Atom 0.19 the keystroke would run the command and insert the diacritic. On this edge version, it only runs the command, which is awesome. 🎉 

BUT, it seems like some internal buffer state then gets messed up. If after the alt-n I move the cursor with the arrows, and then insert a character, the cursor seems to jump back to where the alt-n left me, and the character gets inserted there. If I use a command that isn't a composition character, like `alt-o`, then the problem does not occur.

### Steps to Reproduce

#### Keymap

```
'atom-text-editor':
  'alt-n': 'core:move-down'
  'alt-o': 'core:move-down'
```

1. Add the keymap above to your ~/.atom/keymap.cson
2. Have two lines of text in your buffer:
```
Foo
Bar
```

3. Have the cursor at the beginning of file(before `F` character) Type `alt-n`, then arrow right, then insert a character. Observe that the character is inserted at the beginning of the line (where the `alt-n` left you).
4. Repeat 2-3 using `alt-o` instead of `alt-n`. Observe the insertion happens where the cursor is, as expected.

**Expected behavior:** Character insertion following `alt-n` inserts the character where the cursor is.

**Actual behavior:** Character insertion following `alt-n` inserts the character at the wrong place (seems to be where the `alt-n` leaves you).

**Reproduces how often:** Always.

data.title: onDidChangeScrollTop fired when no scrollTop change / can cause infinite loop
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

`editor.onDidChangeScrollTop` can be fired with same scrollTop value.
And to make matters worse, it can cause infinite loop when registered callback call `component.getScrollTop` and `component.setScrollTop` indirectly.

Why this happen is here

- `editor.component.getScrollTop` update `component.scrollTop` value without **Math.round**
- guard(so that not fire event with same scrollTop) done in `component.setScrollTop` is compared with **rounded** value.

In my package, atom-narrow hit infinite loop because of this behavior(bug IMO).

What was [happened](https://github.com/t9md/atom-narrow/issues/239) is here.

0. In `editor.setScrollTop`
  scrollTop updated from xxx to `522`.
1. `editor.onDidChangeScrollTop` fired with (scrollTop = `522`)
2. In onDidChangeScrollTop callback, call `markerLayer.clear()` which markerLayer is used for text decoration.
3. `editor.onDidChangeScrollTop` fired again(goto step 1, this is infinite loop)
  - In some place, `editor.component.getScrollTop` is accessed which update `component.scrollTop` to `521.65625`)
  `this.scrollTop = Math.min(this.getMaxScrollTop(), this.scrollTop)` = Math.min(521.65625, 522)
  - During etch's rendering, `component.setScrollTop` is called with `548.65625`.
    - result of `scrollTop = Math.round(Math.max(0, Math.min(this.getMaxScrollTop(), scrollTop)))`
    - result of `scrollTop = Math.round(Math.max(0, Math.min(521.65625, 548.65625)))`
    - result of `scrollTop = Math.round(Math.max(0, 521.65625))`
    - result of `scrollTop = 522`
    - scrollTop = `522`
  - `did-change-scroll-top` fired with `522` (`522(rounded) !== 521.65625(<- this.scrollTop updated via getScrollTop)`)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Make sure `editor.scrollPastEnd` is `false` (default).
When `editor.scrollPastEnd` is `true` this issue doesn't happen.

2. Prepare `style.less` bellow. paste&call `reproduceIssue()` on chrome-dev-console.

- style.less

```less
@import "octicon-mixins";
.scrolltop-issue-container {
  padding: @component-padding/3 @component-padding;
}

atom-text-editor {
  .scrolltop-issue-text-hl {
    color: @syntax-color-function;
  }
}
```

```javascript
function reproduceIssue() {
  atom.workspace.open().then(editor => {
    // Render 40 lines of text to make editor scrollable.
    const lines = []
    for (let i = 1; i < 40; i++) {
      lines.push(i)
    }
    editor.setText(lines.join("\n"))

    editor.setCursorBufferPosition([0, 0])

    // To make editor.component.maxScrollTop() have fractional portion(decimal point).
    const item = document.createElement("div")
    item.className = "scrolltop-issue-container"
    item.innerText = "[block decoration]"
    editor.decorateMarker(editor.markBufferPosition([0, 0]), {type: "block", item})

    // prepare decoration layer for text highlight
    const markerLayer = editor.addMarkerLayer()
    editor.decorateMarkerLayer(markerLayer, {type: "text", class: "scrolltop-issue-text-hl"})

    let oldScrollTop
    editor.onDidChangeScrollTop(newScrollTop => {
      console.log("fired")

      // This guard is necessary to prevent infinite loop.
      // if (oldScrollTop === newScrollTop) {
      //   return
      // }

      // Refresh highlight
      markerLayer.clear()
      editor.scan(/1|3|5|7|9/g, ({range}) => markerLayer.markBufferRange(range))

      oldScrollTop = newScrollTop
    })
  })
}
reproduceIssue()
```

3. Move cursor down by `core:move-down`
When last row was appeared, editor freeze by infinite loop on `onDidChangeScrollTop` event. Need to force close.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

`editor.onDidChangeScrollTop` should not be fired when not changed.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

`editor.onDidChangeScrollTop` is emitted with same scrollTop value which possibly cause infinite loop(depends on registered callback).

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

100%

### Versions

OS
```
ProductName:	Mac OS X
ProductVersion:	10.12.5
```

Atom(All stable/beta/master affects).

- Stable
```
Atom    : 1.19.1
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
```

- Beta
```
atom-beta  --version
Atom    : 1.20.0-beta2
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
```

And master branch

### Additional Information

Original issue I hit this issue.
https://github.com/t9md/atom-narrow/issues/239


This guard 

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/15e3fbaa07f90174ab84d35a4281956b54128d12/src/text-editor-component.js#L2713

should be `scrollTop !== Math.round(this.scrollTop)`.

Since calling `getScrollTop` update `this.scrollTop` with non rounded value.

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/15e3fbaa07f90174ab84d35a4281956b54128d12/src/text-editor-component.js#L2707

data.title: getBoundingClientRect called on undefined in TextEditorComponent sometimes
data.body:
Continuing from https://github.com/steelbrain/linter-ui-default/issues/355

What we know so far

- The error comes from [`pixelPositionForMouseEvent `](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/15e3fbaa07f90174ab84d35a4281956b54128d12/src/text-editor-component.js#L1930)
- The error is often from commands like `core:confirm`, `core:copy` etc
- Either `scrollContainer` or `lineTiles` is undefined in Text Editor when those are invoked and it's not handled in Atom internally

First seen on 1.19.0-beta0, still hitting on 1.19.0

My rough guess about what it could be (not dug deep into sources so might be very wrong):

- A race condition after switching pane, those refs aren't yet resolved when the user moves mouse
- Either of these is two occurrences has the object undefined when the text editor is out of focus before moving mouse because in reports, one user had just closed dev tools, other kept switching, closing/reopening pane items
- Maybe the pane component doesn't check if it's been disposed and the items no longer exist and the bug is actually in linter-ui-default requesting mouse positions for closed tabs? (https://github.com/steelbrain/linter-ui-default/pull/420 fixes linter-ui-default side)

data.title: Only clear linesToMeasure when we have actually measured
data.body:
Fixes #15335

Previously, as soon as we decided to render linesToMeasure, we would clear them out. However, if a second update interleaved with the update that initially requested measurement, it could cause the requested lines to not be present when the measurement phase from the first update occurred. Now, any additional updates will only add to the set of lines that need to be measured until the measurement phase actually happens.

/cc @Ben3eeE @50Wliu @ungb

data.title: Hide off-screen lines when we render them for measurement
data.body:
Previously, we weren't hiding off-screen lines that we rendered for measurement. That could cause flickering artifacts like the one below when re-triggering measurements, as well as the cursors div being pushed down momentarily.

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1058982/29333256-63dfdf1e-8203-11e7-9587-bccb69c4377a.gif)

/cc @as-cii @Ben3eeE

data.title: Remeasure the longest line's width when the font size changes
data.body:
Previously, we weren't invalidating the old longest line measurement when changing the font size. This could mean that the lines div would get stuck at the wrong width.

/cc @as-cii @50Wliu @Ben3eeE In case there are any issues you think this might be related to. I noticed this while testing something else.

data.title: Atom 1.19.1 - atom.open causes Atom to takeover as active foreground app
data.body:
I am the author of an Atom package called [git-tabs](https://atom.io/packages/git-tabs) which closes and reopens tabs based upon the projects current git branch. I am running into an issue with Atom entering the OS X foreground as the active application when changing branches.

It appears that the culprit in my code is the usage of `atom.open` when this is invoked and the Atom application is in the background (not minimized), the tabs are opened then Atom takes over as the active foreground application.

I have tried using the option `newWindow` and setting it to false but Atom still takes over as the active foreground application.

data.title: Base context menu accelerators on activeElement
data.body:
Addresses issue pointed by out @nathansobo in #15277 where keybindings
for unfocusable nodes were being surfaced as accelerator indicators in
context menus.

When you right click in the DOM, your focus goes to the first focusable
ancestor of your click target. This change uses the ancestor that you
are actually focused on when looking for avaliable key bindings rather
than using the event target directly. This ensures that any surfaced key
bindings are actually reachable.
